author: sky.cactus
content: As we approach The Merge, I would like to have some wider discussions on some of the constant settings we plan on using with PoS.

author: sky.cactus
content: In particular, weak subjectivity time, withdraw time (which I believe are tightly related), time to finality, are all things that IIUC can be tuned pretty easily and were set using a "meh, this feels right" initially (someone please correct me if I'm wrong here and there is some technical reason why certain constant values were used).

author: sky.cactus
content: First step in this process would be fully understanding specifically what tunable constants there are, and what downstream effects each constant has.

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't know the answer, but the *impression* I have gotten from prior discussions is that withdraw time and weak subjectivity are on the order of "weeks", but these things feel like they should be on the order of "months".

author: sky.cactus
content: Specifically, I feel that in order to make PoS secure against malicious stakers, we (the Ethereum community) need to be able to pose the credible threat of slashing by social consensus (e.g., hard fork irregular state change slashing).

author: sky.cactus
content: I feel like "weeks" is not a sufficient amount of time to make that threat credible, but months is.

author: potuz
content: Although it pains me since my (tiny to some) two validators have become by orders of magnitude the vast majority of my savings and I'm hoping to liquidate them as soon as I can, I agree with <@301186049323958275> here. And moreover we can probably adjust down the economic constants without really affecting security: institutional staking will most probably stay, and lone validators forfeiting essentially MEV, are not doing it for the money anyway
